page.title: 04Coleshill,rivers and ponds.
page.content: Coleshill has two rivers,one which it derives its name from-the Cole and the river Blythe which flows to the east of the town.The river Cole has had its course altered and straightened a lot to try to reduce the flooding in Cole End.The mill,mill house,leet and ford have all gone.The river Blythe is an unspoiled river which meanders throuhg the countryside with many pastures arount it used for for grazing of cattle.Fishing contests are held regularly on the Blythe and swans are seen regularly.The old {" Stonebridge Railway}"travelled along the valley and crossed the Blythe several times.Most of the bridges have been dismantled but some footpaths follow the track.There are still many ponds in the area,some quite big,some filled in.Some dry up in summer.The rivers and ponds are used for watering
